Description: Sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis, consisting of rim, neck, and bowl; interior glazed black with band in added red at top of sherd; ray pattern on top of flat rim; alternating verticals and red dots on outside; band at top of wall; below, three incised spoke rosettes with red on centres and most petals; on lower wall, black-figure decoration consisting of feline (head and neck with red on mane remaining), to right; at far right, possibly part of a wing; incised splinter rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.549 and Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.172.1894.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.15)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 330, no. B378)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0758) (Phase 1)
